title.narrative: Civic Engagement Alliance in Indonesia

description.narrative: As part of the global program, Civic Engagement Alliance in Indonesia will resulting the empowered smallholders and civil society organizations, to contribute for the development of the national action plan, to cope the gap between human rights and business practices.

The sustainable livelihood and justice for all are ICCO program pillars. To addressing problematics faced by smallholders producers, labour in agri-food industries; lobby to companies and advocating policies for responsible and sustainable production and consumption is important. ICCO facilitate collaboration of CSO, companies and government to work together for mutual interest.

activity-description.narrative: Facilitate the development of new initiatives for economic empowerment with CSO, companies and government
Facilitate the exchange knowledge, lobby &#38; advocacy, monitoring and evaluation through Regional Office

description.narrative: Together with partner, ICCO supporting local initiatives to improve child rights protection, respects and remedies.

activity-description.narrative: Series of discussions with multistakholder partners e.g. civil society organizations, companies &#38; government.
Training with farmers cooperative on spice sector

title.narrative: Project image
Political space - impact
Number of bills with positive impacts for the lives of the poor and marginalized that were adopted (partly) due to CSOs lobby and advocacy

comment.narrative: This indicator refers to: # government favourable policies for smallholders

title.narrative: Responsible Business - impact
Number of companies that have a policy in place on making their production socially sustainable

comment.narrative: This indicator links to: # companies that include zero tolerance of engagement with child labor in their responsible business policy

title.narrative: Political space - other
# cases of joint felt ownership by NGOs, government and private sector of pro-poor agenda (including rules and regulation) on inclusive finance

# cases of joint ownership by CSOs, universities, private sector associations, national and regional (AEAN) associations of a L&A agenda towards private sector assosciations in agrifood based crops / land
# joint learning events organized between CSOs, government and the private sector to have constructive dialogue and negatiation in collaboration with IBCSD and GKPI
# private sector players that join the commodity boards on rice and spices
# CSOs that give recommendations to government on proposed policy changes on RB
# private sector players that communicate positively on the establishment of new commodity boards
# NGOs that lobby towards government and private sector players for establishment of commodity boards on rice and spices
# CSOs who advocate for Indonesian NAP formulation

# events organized on formulating rules and regulation towards Indonesian NAP in which CSOs, universities, private sector associations, national and regional (ASEAN) level associations actively participate
# strategic coalitions formed through national and regional networking events
# NGOs that lobby for good small producer representation on commodity boards
# good examples on responsible business documented
# private sector partners who work with farmers' groups on using standardized commodities
# NGOs trained in L&A
# government decision makers that are convinced of the need of establlishing commodity boards for rice and spices
# private sector representatives who have increased understanding of responsible business
# CSOs who have been trained in UNGP
# CSOs included in the CEA program that don't get financing but are part of the networks CEA cooperates with
# CSOs included in the CEA program who get financing
Political space - outcome
Number of cases where local and national authorities actively consult the poor and marginalized and CSOs

comment.narrative: This indicator refers to: # CSOs, chambers of commerce, commodity boards who were approached by government for policidialogues
